intro: Vangueria randii subsp. chartacea, commonly known as the Natal fan-flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often lobed and have a rough texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
